Title: Lolita
Taglines: How did they ever make a movie of Lolita?
Production_Co: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer (MGM), Seven Arts Pictures, A.A. Productions Ltd.
Trivia: In the novel, Lolita is a brunette. In the film, she is a blonde. See more »
Goofs: A bottle seen standing on the piano bench in Quilty's house is no longer there when Quilty sits to play at the piano. See more »
Crazy_Credits: The credits are played over footage of Lolita's toenails being painted. See more »
Cast: James Mason, Shelley Winters, Sue Lyon, Gary Cockrell, Jerry Stovin, Diana Decker, Lois Maxwell, Cec Linder, Bill Greene, Shirley Douglas, Marianne Stone, Marion Mathie, James Dyrenforth, Maxine Holden, John Harrison
Plot: A middle-aged college professor becomes infatuated with a fourteen-year-old nymphet. Humbert Humbert, a divorced British professor of French literature, travels to small-town America for a teaching position. He allows himself to be swept into a relationship with Charlotte Haze, his widowed and sexually famished landlady, whom he marries in order that he might pursue the woman's 14-year-old flirtatious daughter, Lolita, with whom he has fallen hopelessly in love, but whose affections shall be thwarted by a devious trickster named Clare Quilty. Written by filmfactsman
Keywords: professor, nymphet, lolita, writer, older man young girl relationship
Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 2 wins & 7 nominations.
Actors: James Mason, Shelley Winters, Sue Lyon
Description: Directed by Stanley Kubrick.  With James Mason, Shelley Winters, Sue Lyon, Gary Cockrell. A middle-aged college professor becomes infatuated with a fourteen-year-old nymphet.
